class dimcat.musana.harmony_types.HarmonyQuality(stack_size: int, interval_class_quality_list: List[dimcat.musana.harmony_types.P | dimcat.musana.harmony_types.IP])[source]¶

Bases: object

Examples: stack_of_thirds_3_Mm = HarmonyQuality(stacksize=3,ic_quality_list=[IP(1),IP(-1)]) # Major triad stack_of_thirds_4_mmm = HarmonyQuality(stacksize=3,ic_quality_list=[IP(-1),IP(-1),IP(-1)]) # fully diminished 7th stack_of_fifth_4_PPP = HarmonyQuality(stacksize=5,ic_quality_list=[P(0),P(0),P(0)]) stack_of_fifth_3_ADP = HarmonyQuality(stacksize=5,ic_quality_list=[P(-1),P(1),P(0)])

interval_class_quality_list: List[dimcat.musana.harmony_types.P | dimcat.musana.harmony_types.IP]¶
classmethod smart_init(n_chord_tones: int, upper: bool, form_symbol: Literal['o', '+', '%', 'M', '+M', '']) → Self[source]¶
stack_size: int¶
class dimcat.musana.harmony_types.HarmonyRegexes[source]¶

Bases: object

a class to hold all the regular expressions in the harmony string input

added_tone_regex = re.compile('(\\+[#b]*\\d*)')¶
arabic_degree_regex = re.compile('^(?P<modifiers>[#b]*)(?P<number>(\\d+))$')¶
figuredbass_regex = re.compile('(?P<figbass>(7|65|43|42|2|64|6))')¶
key_regex = re.compile('^(?P<class>[A-G])(?P<modifiers>(b*)|(#*))$', re.IGNORECASE)¶
replacement_tone_regex = re.compile('([\\^v][#b]*\\d*)')¶
roman_degree_regex = re.compile('^(?P<modifiers>[#b]*)(?P<roman_numeral>([VI]+))$', re.IGNORECASE)¶
class dimcat.musana.harmony_types.IP(alt_steps: int)[source]¶

Bases: IntervalQuality

This is a type class for Imperfect intervals alt_steps = 1 means M2, M3, M6 … alt_steps = 2 means A2, A3, A6 … alt_steps = 3 means AA2, AA3, … alt_steps = -1 means m2, m3, m6 …

alt_steps: int¶
classmethod from_interval_class(spelled_interval_class: SpelledIntervalClass) → Self[source]¶

class dimcat.musana.harmony_types.P(alt_steps: int)[source]¶

Bases: IntervalQuality

This is a type class for perfect intervals alt_steps = 0 means e.g. perfect unison, perfect fifths alt_steps = 1 means aug 1 (A1), aug 5(A5), aug 4… alt_steps = -1 means dim 1 (D1) …

alt_steps: int¶
classmethod from_interval_class(spelled_interval_class: SpelledIntervalClass) → Self[source]¶
